CHOLERA VACCINE

VACCINES

  • Indications and doses
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Administration
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Immunisation against cholera (for travellers to endemic or epidemic areas on the basis of current recommendations),

By mouth

  • For adults
    1 dose every 1–6 weeks for 2 doses, if more than 6 weeks have elapsed between doses, the primary course should be restarted, immunisation should be completed at least one week before potential exposure.
  • For children 2–5 years
    1 dose every 1–6 weeks for 3 doses, if more than 6 weeks have elapsed between doses, the primary course should be restarted, immunisation should be completed at least one week before potential exposure.
  • For children 6–17 years
    1 dose every 1–6 weeks for 2 doses, if more than 6 weeks have elapsed between doses, the primary course should be restarted, immunisation should be completed at least one week before potential exposure.

Booster,

By mouth

  • For adults
    A single booster dose can be given within 2 years after primary course, if more than 2 years have elapsed since the last vaccination, the primary course should be repeated.
  • For children 2–5 years
    A single booster dose can be given within 6 months after primary course, if more than 6 months have elapsed since the last vaccination, the primary course should be repeated.
  • For children 6–17 years
    A single booster dose can be given within 2 years after primary course, if more than 2 years have elapsed since the last vaccination, the primary course should be repeated.

Contra indications

  • Acute gastro-intestinal illness

Known side effects

General side effects

rare: Cough, respiratory symptoms, rhinitis,

veryRare: Insomnia, sore throat,

notKnown: Abdominal pain and cramps, diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting,

Directions for administration

In children

Dissolve effervescent sodium bicarbonate granules in a glassful of water or chlorinated water (approximately 150 mL). For children over 6 years, add vaccine suspension to make one dose. For child 2–6 years, discard half (approximately 75 mL) of the solution, then add vaccine suspension to make one dose. Drink within 2 hours. Food, drink, and other oral medicines should be avoided for 1 hour before and after vaccination.

In adults

Dissolve effervescent sodium bicarbonate granules in a glassful of water or chlorinated water (approximately 150 mL). Add vaccine suspension to make one dose. Drink within 2 hours. Food, drink, and other oral medicines should be avoided for 1 hour before and after vaccination.

Advice for patients and carers

Counselling on administration advised.

Immunisation with cholera vaccine does not provide complete protection and all travellers to a country where cholera exists should be warned that scrupulous attention to food, water, and personal hygiene is essential.

Prepared medicinal forms of CHOLERA VACCINE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Oral suspension
